intro: Myosotis pectinata, commonly known as the spoonleaf forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its distinctive spoon-shaped leaves and clusters of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. Myosotis pectinata is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
